headline: Spirit Airlines to halt 40 routes, hires ex-Amazon network executive
summary: Spirit Airlines will suspend 40 routes in its November schedule and has hired former Amazon executive Andrea Lusso as vice president of network planning, according to a memo seen by Reuters. "These network changes include multiple routes that are seasonal or only operate on certain days of the week," the low-budget carrier said in the memo. Earlier this week, Spirit furloughed one-third of its flight attendants as the carrier grapples with dwindling cash and mounting losses.

headline: MAC.BID Makes Georgia Debut with Online Auction, Bin Store Opening in Macon
summary: Online retail liquidation company, MAC.BID, announced today the opening of a new location in Macon, Georgia, on October 4, continuing the company's rapid national growth. The Pennsylvania-based company now operates nearly 30 locations across the country, with recent expansion underway in Arizona, Colorado, Nevada, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Tennessee, and Texas.

headline: Amazon loses VP helping lead development of artificial general intelligence
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -An Amazon vice president helping to oversee one of the company's highest profile projects, artificial general intelligence, is stepping down on Friday, the online retailer confirmed after a Reuters inquiry.  Karthik Ramakrishnan, a 13-year veteran of Amazon, is stepping down, according to internal communications reviewed by Reuters.  It could not be learned if he had another job lined up and Ramakrishnan did not respond to a request for comment.

raw.headline: Amazon loses VP helping lead development of artificial general intelligence
raw.summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -An Amazon vice president helping to oversee one of the company's highest profile projects, artificial general intelligence, is stepping down on Friday, the online retailer confirmed after a Reuters inquiry.  Karthik Ramakrishnan, a 13-year veteran of Amazon, is stepping down, according to internal communications reviewed by Reuters.  It could not be learned if he had another job lined up and Ramakrishnan did not respond to a request for comment.

headline: Anthropic to triple international workforce as AI models drive growth outside US
summary: Nearly 80% of consumer usage for Claude comes from outside the United States, with per-person usage in countries like South Korea, Australia and Singapore outpacing that of America, the company said.  Anthropic, valued at $183 billion and backed by Google-parent Alphabet and Amazon.com, has distinguished itself, in part, by building AI models that excel at coding.  Its Claude large language models are widely regarded as one of the most powerful frontier models on the market, and this has helped grow the company's global business customer base from under 1,000 to more than 300,000 in two years.

headline: The Week in Numbers: Trump dominates tariffs, TikTok and Tylenol
summary: STORY: From Trump's latest tariffs to his issue with Tylenol... this is the Week in Numbers.:: 100%100% tariffs on imported branded drugs was part of the latest barrage of tariffs announced by Donald Trump. He also applied 25% levies on heavy-duty trucks.With the latest salvo due to come into force at the beginning of October.Trump says he wants to protect the U.S. manufacturing industry and national security.:: 35 million35 million Amazon Prime customers are set to get money back from Amazon.That's after the Federal Trade Commission ruled the company had duped customers to generate subscriptions.It ordered Amazon to cough up $2.5 billion in penalties.:: 12%12% was how much Orsted shares rose by after a U.S. federal judge ruled the energy firm can resume work on the almost completed Revolution Wind project.Trump's administration had stopped the scheme last month.The Danish offshore wind power developer has lost $2 million a day since August when the project was halted.::$14 billion$14 billion is how much US Vice President JD Vance said TikTok is worth - putting a price tag on the short video app for the first time."And here's your final copy. TikTok."Trump signed an executive order declaring that his plan to sell TikTok's U.S. operations to U.S. and global investors will address the national security requirements in a 2024 law.It's amid efforts to extract TikTok's U.S. assets from the global platform and win approval from the Chinese government.Trump said Chinese President Xi Jinping agreed to the deal."I spoke with President XI. I had a good talk. I told him what we were doing and he said, go ahead with it.":: 7%Shares of Tylenol-maker Kenvue rose as much as 7% rebounding from a record low.That's after investors shrugged off unproven claims from Donald Trump linking the popular pain reliever to autism.Trump had connected autism to the use of Tylenol by pregnant women, elevating claims that are not supported by scientific evidence.

raw.headline: The Week in Numbers: Trump dominates tariffs, TikTok and Tylenol
raw.summary: STORY: From Trump's latest tariffs to his issue with Tylenol... this is the Week in Numbers.:: 100%100% tariffs on imported branded drugs was part of the latest barrage of tariffs announced by Donald Trump. He also applied 25% levies on heavy-duty trucks.With the latest salvo due to come into force at the beginning of October.Trump says he wants to protect the U.S. manufacturing industry and national security.:: 35 million35 million Amazon Prime customers are set to get money back from Amazon.That's after the Federal Trade Commission ruled the company had duped customers to generate subscriptions.It ordered Amazon to cough up $2.5 billion in penalties.:: 12%12% was how much Orsted shares rose by after a U.S. federal judge ruled the energy firm can resume work on the almost completed Revolution Wind project.Trump's administration had stopped the scheme last month.The Danish offshore wind power developer has lost $2 million a day since August when the project was halted.::$14 billion$14 billion is how much US Vice President JD Vance said TikTok is worth - putting a price tag on the short video app for the first time."And here's your final copy. TikTok."Trump signed an executive order declaring that his plan to sell TikTok's U.S. operations to U.S. and global investors will address the national security requirements in a 2024 law.It's amid efforts to extract TikTok's U.S. assets from the global platform and win approval from the Chinese government.Trump said Chinese President Xi Jinping agreed to the deal."I spoke with President XI. I had a good talk. I told him what we were doing and he said, go ahead with it.":: 7%Shares of Tylenol-maker Kenvue rose as much as 7% rebounding from a record low.That's after investors shrugged off unproven claims from Donald Trump linking the popular pain reliever to autism.Trump had connected autism to the use of Tylenol by pregnant women, elevating claims that are not supported by scientific evidence.
